passages.text: Rating Change: NEUTRAL | PO: 3.15 PHP | Price: 2.88 PHP

We raise our discounted cash flow (DCF)- based PO for Nickel Asia Corp. (NIKL) by \(19\%\) to Php3.15, and upgrade to Neutral from Underperform, considering 1) the sustainability of exports to Indonesia (at least five years) on top of raw nickel ore exports to China; and 2) higher export prices as demand rises; 3) roll over valuation base to FY26E; and 4) lower WACC rate by 0.64ppt to \(8.14\%\) . We raise our Shanghai Metal Exchange (SME)- based FY26E export price assumptions to US \(40 / WMT\) from US \(25 / WMT\) . We raise our FY25E/26E net profit by \(11\% /13\%\) to Php2.6bn/Php2.7bn. Our Neutral rating is based on improved 2025- 27E earnings estimates, underpinned by new exports to Indonesia and moderate undervaluation relative to global peers. NIKL trades at \(14x\) FY26E PER. At our DCF- based PO, NIKL would trade at FY26E PER of \(16x\) , within the global average of implied PER of \(16.3x\) . We also factor in funding for NIKLs renewable energy projects to commence in 2026, which is a 60:40 joint venture with Shell Investments, B.V.

NIKL's 1H25 core profit of Php1.3bn rose \(16\%\) YoY, driven by higher realized SME- based export (to China/Indonesia; \(60\%\) of NIKL's volume) prices). This was partially offset by lower export volume sales due to inclement weather conditions in the early part of 1H25, lower LME- based prices (for HPALs: \(40\%\) of NIKL's volume), lower realized foreign exchange, higher variable expenses (mainly from excise tax and shipping/loading costs) and higher taxes. 2Q25 core profit grew \(75\%\) YoY to Php1.6bn, mainly on higher realized export prices. Meanwhile, energy production of the renewable energy unit, Emerging Power Inc. (EPI), rose by \(8\%\) YoY in 1H25, but spot prices were lower by \(14\%\) at Php4.47/kwh, causing EBITDA to fall \(12\%\) YoY to Php460mn. New solar farms to commence operations in 2026. Gains from CBNC stake (Php0.8bn) in 1Q25.

1H25/2Q25 revenue rose \(27\% /34\%\) YoY to Php12bn/Php9bn as realized 1H export prices rose by \(75\%\) YoY to US \(38.31 / WMT\) and offset the weak export volume sales, down by \(3.8\%\) YoY to 7.85mn WMT. Downside risk: Possible change in PH mining tax regime.

Nickel Asia Corporation (NIKL PM) is one of the largest suppliers of lateritic nickel ore globally and the largest nickel mining company in the Philippines, with a long history of nickel laterite mining dating back to 1977. The Zamora family owns a majority stake through Mantra Resources at \(38\%\) . NI Capital Corp. and Sumitomo Metal Mining Philippines Holdings Corp. own \(14\%\) and \(25\%\) , respectively. Public float is \(23\%\) . NIKL is ramping up solar farm capacities which targets for a total of 1GW by 2028

We rate Nickel Asia Corporation's (NIKL) a Neutral as new customer for raw nickel ore, Indonesia would likely to be on a long- term (5- years) basis and this is on top of demand from China. However, the Shanghai Metal exchange- based prices may taper after five years. Price parity in shipping raw nickel ore to both countries are minimal. However, as demand rises for NIKL's raw nickel ore, prices may rise. Solar farm projects may become earnings accretive in 2026 as soon as it starts to energize.

Early this year, the Indonesian government limited nickel ore production to balance global supply and elected to welcome \(1.5\%\) ore grade of nickel ore shipments from the Philippines, which is similarly priced as exporting nickel ore to China. NIKL has agreed to sell 10mn WMT of \(1.5\%\) nickel ore to Indonesia. This is \(3\% - 4\%\) of Indonesia's annual requirements. This would have a volume ratio of \(50\%\) with that of China. This would technically be a target of 20mn WMT, barring any weather disturbance in the mines. For the past three years, NIKL has been averaging 11mn WMT of nickel ore production and it looks like China's muted property development eventually slowed demand for stainless steel, of which nickel pig iron is the raw material, and, as such, Philippine \(1.5\%\) grade nickel ore is a raw material of nickel pig iron. It is timely that Indonesia's demand for raw nickel ore rose as NIKL was able to open new mines. NIKL's ability to supply demand is supported by its newly opened mine. NIKL assets' average mine life is 18 years.
Indonesia imposed a graduated taxation on local raw nickel ore ranging from \(14\%\) to \(19\%\) depending on the London Metal Exchange (LME) prices. This used to be a single rate tax of \(10\%\) .

We see upside risks: 1) recovery of demand for stainless steel in China, and 2) earnings contribution of new projects at the renewable energy unit, which will all commence in 2026. This would lower capex significantly and potentially raise NIKL's cash flow and valuation. Sustained higher export prices and significantly lesser capital expenditure and debt could result in higher cash dividend payout.

There is a proposal by lawmakers to ban nickel ore exports; however, this has not progressed much since its inception. Beyond 2030, Shanghai Metal prices may revert to lower nickel ore prices due to a change in Indonesian administration.
A new mining tax regime in the Philippines is up to be signed into law and may be implemented in early 2026. This may cut NIKL's earnings by about \(3\%\) , based on our forecasts.
Exhibit 2:Key changes in price and foreign exchange assumptions
Source: BofA Global Research, NIKL PEP estimates

Significant change in our assumptions is raising our export (to Indonesia/China) price for FY25E/26E by \(60\% /33\%\) to US \(40/40\) per WMT. This is partially offset by 1) lower assumed USDPPHP for the same period by \(7\% /5\%\) . This raises our FY25E/26E revenue forecast by \(17\% /10\%\) to Php26.8/Php22.9bn. Consequently, we raise our FY25E/26E net profit by \(11\% /13\%\) to Php2.6/Php2.7bn, respectively. LME nickel prices (for HPAL) remain muted and lowered by \(7\% /5\%\) for FY25E/26E.

The jump in export prices to an average of US \(40 / WMT\) , up \(60\%\) , may lift our FY25E net profit by \(71\%\) to Php2.6bn and followed by a \(20\%\) growth in FY27E to Php3.2bn on account of \(11\%\) higher LME nickel price assumption to US \(59.07 / lb\) , based on BofA global mining price forecasts dated 1 August 2025. - Global Mining Weekly. This forecast for global nickel supply deficit. Beyond 2030, we believe, Shanghai Metal prices may revert to lower prices due to uncertainties.
Source: NIKL, PEP estimates

ValuationOur discounted cash flow (DCF)- based price objective of Php3.15 considers its net cash flows over 18 years (2026- 44), the average mine life of NIKL's mines. We lower our WACC, our discount rate, by 0.64ppt to 8.14%. We retain our FY25E/26E capex assumption at Php10bn/Php10bn, which is mainly due to renewable energy unit's projects that are targeted to be completed by 2026. NIKL currently trades at 14x FY26E PER. At our DCF- based PO, NIKL would trade at an implied FY26E PER of 16x within the global average of implied PER of 16.3x.

We update our major key assumptions to calculate WACC, mainly on lowering by 10ppt in % debt to asset, higher by 10ppt on % of equity to asset as total debt, asset and equity balances rose by \(7.5\% /8.9\%\) and \(27.4\%\) , respectively; cost of debt is also lowered by 2.8ppt to \(4.5\%\)

NIKL's 1H25 core profit of Php1.3bn, up by \(16\%\) , was driven by higher realized export prices (to China/Indonesia; \(60\%\) of NIKL's volume). This was partially offset by lower export volume sales due to inclement weather conditions in the early part of 1H25, lower LME prices (to HPALs; \(40\%\) of NIKL's volume), lower realized foreign exchange, higher variable expenses (mainly from excise tax and shipping/loading costs) and higher taxes. 2Q25 core profit was up \(75\%\) YoY at Php1.6bn, mainly on higher realized export prices. We note that in 1Q25, NIKL booked a one- time gain of Php800mn from the sale of \(15\%\) stake in Coral Bay Nickel Corp. Meanwhile, the energy production of renewable energy unit, Emerging Power, Inc. (EPI), rose by \(8\%\) in 1H25 but spot prices were lower by \(14\%\) to Php4.47/kwh, weighing down on EBITDA, causing it to fall by \(12\%\) YoY to Php460mn. New solar farms will likely commence operations in 2026.

1H25/2Q25 revenue up \(27\% /34\%\) YoY at Ph12bn/Php9bn as realized 1H25 export prices rose by \(75\%\) YoY to US \(38.31 / \mathrm{WMT}\) and offset the weak export volume sales, down by \(3.8\%\) YoY to \(7.85\mathrm{mn}\) WMT and lower realized LME prices to HPALs by \(12.3\%\) to US \(6.96 / \mathrm{lb}\) . USDHP in 1H25 was lower by \(1.8\%\) to Php56.47. In 2Q25, realized export/LME prices per WMT/lb. changed by \(118.3\% / - 18\%\) to US \(40.02 / US\) 6.87.

NIKL's 1H25 core profit of Php1.3bn, up by \(16\%\) (beat our estimates), driven by higher realized export prices. This was partially offset by lower export volume sales due to inclement weather conditions in early part of 1H25, lower LME prices, lower realized foreign exchange, higher variable expenses (mainly from excise tax and shipping/loading costs) and higher taxes. 2Q25 core profit was up \(75\%\) YoY at Php1.6bn, mainly on higher realized export prices. Recall that in 1Q25, NIKL booked a one- time gain of Php800mn from the sale of \(15\%\) stake in Coral Bay Nickel Corp.

Our price objective of \(\mathsf{PHP3.15 / share}\) is derived using a DCF valuation methodology on the remaining 18- year mine life of the five active nickel mine assets, namely, Taganito, Upper South Guitulanun, Dinapigue and Manicani mines, and NIKL's \(10\%\) stake in Taganito HPAL in Surigao. On top of these, NIKL is investing in additional 1,440MWp capacity of FY25E/26E with a total capex of more than \(\mathsf{Php17bn}\) . Annual maintenance capex in ore mining is raised from \(\mathsf{Php800mn}\) previously to \(\mathsf{Php1.665bn}\) , The discount rate is equivalent to WACC of \(8.14\%\) with risk premium factor of \(6.0\%\) , risk- free rate of \(5.0\%\) with a beta of \(0.796x\) .

Upside risks: (1) better- than- expected sales volume, (2) exacerbated deficit in the nickel market, (3) better nickel prices (4) regulatory clarity, (5) opening of new mines and prolonging mine life, (5) earnings contribution of new projects at the renewable energy unit, which will all commence in 2026 (6) new off taker of nickel ore volume, and (7) recovery of demand for stainless steel in China.

Downside risks: (1) unrealized deficit in the nickel market, (2) worsening regulatory uncertainties, (3) soft demand for nickel ore and a relative soft price, (4) sudden surge in nickel supply may soften LME nickel price, (5) Indonesia decides to lift ban on exporting raw nickel ore, (6) technological advancement replacing nickel as a major component of EV batteries, and (7) implementation of the proposed new Philippine mining tax regime by PH government.
